body.title: Otselic Valley Central School District Home

meta.name: viewport

form.name: form1

div.span: NO SCHOOL FOR STUDENTS UNTIL AT LEAST May 15, 2020 -- students have received learning materials for use at home

span.div: Due to the coronavirus/COVID-19 outbreak, school is closed until May 15, 2020 at the earliest. Food is being delivered daily along bus routes, and all students have materials for learning at home. Anyone age 18 and younger who is residing with a family having at least one child enrolled in our district can get food through TWO drive-up/walk-up sites, either the South Otselic or Georgetown schools, from 9 am - 11:30 am, Monday-Friday.INFO: Otselic Valley's Coronavirus (COVID-19) information page. Click here for frequent updates: https://www.ovcs.org/CoronavirusCOVID-19InformationPage.aspx

a.title: open white cooler with snowflake in it, and sign reading Thank you South Otselic Store

img.title: open white cooler with snowflake in it, and sign reading Thank you South Otselic Store
img.alt: South Otselic Store donates coolers for daily food deliveries

div.a: South Otselic Store donates coolers for daily food deliveries

br.span: Thanks to the South Otselic Store’s donation of 20 styrofoam coolers, daily food deliveries to students are now safer for students as well as for aides and bus drivers.

a.title: gold and black sunburst logo against grey background with sign that reads Otselic Valley Central School Updates April 16, 2020

img.title: gold and black sunburst logo against grey background with sign that reads Otselic Valley Central School Updates April 16, 2020

br.span: In a message for the Otselic Valley community, Mr. Berson shares more about the April 16, 2020 update from the New York State Health Department and the Governor regarding the coronavirus/COVID-19 outbreak: school closures are extended through May 15, 2020, and school district voting originally scheduled for May 19, 2020 is postponed at least until June 2, 2020, subject to further directives from the Governor and the New York State Education Department,.

a.title: small wooden people figures are connected by white lines going from head to head

img.title: small wooden people figures are connected by white lines going from head to head
img.alt: Board of Education meeting access for April 14, 2020

div.a: Board of Education meeting access for April 14, 2020

br.span: The Board of Education meeting scheduled for April 14, 2020 at 7:00 pm will be held in the Conference Room. Due to the New York State mandate requiring social distancing and limited public gatherings, the public will be allowed to listen in via a teleconference. (Instructions provided)

a.title: A Viking helmet against a wood panel backdrop reads Otselic Valley Central School Updates Thursday April 9 2020

img.title: A Viking helmet against a wood panel backdrop reads Otselic Valley Central School Updates Thursday April 9 2020

br.span: In a message to families, Mr. Berson addresses your questions about what the Governor’s extended school closure means for our students’ online instruction, grades, graduation requirements, June Regents exams which have now been cancelled, and the budget. A New York State Education Department link is also available.

img.title: sunburst logo reads O V
img.alt: News from Mr. Berson about Regents exams and extended school closure

div.a: News from Mr. Berson about Regents exams and extended school closure

br.span: Important announcements: On April 6, 2020, the New York State Board of Regents announced cancellation of the 2020 Regents exams, and the Governor extended school closures statewide until April 29, 2020. Mr. Berson shares more about what this means for our school district including continued online instruction, food distribution, available behavioral health and planning support, and important public health resources. More information from the New York State Education Department about graduation requirements is expected shortly.

a.title: sunburst logo in background on yellow with words that read From Mrs. Richards Otselic Valley Central School

img.title: sunburst logo in background on yellow with words that read From Mrs. Richards Otselic Valley Central School

br.span: We know these are trying times for all of our families. Please understand that our teachers are working hard to find ways to connect with each student/family. They are trying to keep the learning momentum moving forward. However, we understand that this is all new to you too. Some families have members still working. Some families have unreliable internet access. We ask that you encourage your children to do the best they can. Encourage them to ask for help. Let them take breaks. We do not expect them to be able to make every zoom or google meeting. Let them go outside. Let them play and talk to them about how they are feeling during these uncertain times.

div.a: Annual Budget Hearing, 7:00 PM, mirrored cafeteria
Policy Committee Meeting, 6:00 PM, Conference Room
Budget Vote and Board Member Election/Regular Board Meeting, 7:00 PM, mirrored cafeteria

a.title: two rows of students in hoodies and blue jeans, with female teachers standing right and left

img.title: two rows of students in hoodies and blue jeans, with female teachers standing right and left

div.span: This past weekend, ten FFA members from the Otselic Valley FFA chapter attended the 212/360 Leadership Conference in Syracuse with about 900 other FFA members from across the state. This two-day event’s theme was “Influence.” The conference included sessions where students learned how to define influence and identify the influence process, along with recognize positive characteristics in relationships. Students learned how to determine if someone is trustworthy and explored methods for building others’ trust. They also learned about leadership and purpose. They participated in activities that taught them how to build relationships within their chapter and how to positively influence others. We are proud of all of the FFA members who took time out of their weekend to learn how to be a positive influence for our FFA chapter, school and community. Good job!

a.title: framed photos cover a brown bulletin board

img.title: framed photos cover a brown bulletin board

div.span: On January 23, 2020, senior Dakota Hackett earned his 100th career win! At a dual meet at Morrisville-Eaton where Otselic Valley wrestlers participate through shared athletics, a pin in the second periods put Dakota squarely in the 100s. Contratulations, Dakota!

a.title: 3 teenage girls in crowns, sashes, hold flowers

img.title: 3 teenage girls in crowns, sashes, hold flowers
img.alt: Chenango County Dairy Princesses from O V

div.a: Chenango County Dairy Princesses from O V

div.span: Congratulations to the newly crowned Chenango County Dairy Princess Paige Warren, the Chenango County Alternate Dairy Princess Cassie Agren, and the Chenango County Dairy Ambassadors Peyton and Skyler Graham. Their jobs are to promote the dairy industry and dairy products by speaking to school and public groups. Crowning occurred at the annual banquet held in Norwich on Sunday, May 26, 2019. Almost half of the Chenango County Dairy Court are Otselic Valley students!
